programme.title: Species
programme.desc: She's beautiful, seductive, intelligent...and her charms could spell doom for the entire human race! Ben Kingsley, Forest Whitaker and Natasha Henstridge star in this adrenaline-charged sci-fi hit.

programme.title: Ender's Game
programme.desc: In the wake of an alien invasion, an unlikely recruit— a young and brilliant boy—is chosen to command the forces of Earth and fight for the future of our species.

programme.title: Earth Girls Are Easy
programme.desc: Three aliens (Jim Carrey, Damon Wayans and Jeff Goldblum) crash-land in Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley. A manicurist (Geena Davis) and her boss (Julie Brown) befriend the threesome, give them makeovers and showing them the town.

programme.title: The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon. Physicist. Rock Star. With the help of his unique team, Buckaroo Banzai (Peter Weller) is ready to save the world on a moment's notice. But after his successful test of the Oscillation Overthruster, the evil Red Lectroids are unleashed from the 8th dimension. Led by Lord John Whorfin (John Lithgow), the Lectroids steal the Overthruster. But no matter where you go, there Buckaroo Banzai is...ready to battle an interdimensional menace that could spell doom for the entire human race.

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: While practicing the tricks of the trade, a neophyte hacker does the nearly impossible: he hacks the highly secured computer at a large mineral corporation and taps into an embezzling plot masked by a computer virus with the ability to destroy the world's ecosystem! And when the young hacker and his pals are targeted for the crime, the group must launch a massive cyber-attack that will hopefully clear their names and prevent an ecological disaster. Jonny Lee Miller and Angelina Jolie star.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Arrest" - Police are driving down the street when a man suddenly jumps in front of their car. They screech to a halt and avoid hitting him, but the man is highly agitated.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "On The Run" - Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Old Wounds Run Deep" - A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Business" - Dr. G. has just graduated from medical school and is set to begin her first job as an M.E. in Jacksonville, Florida when a high-profile case challenges her to use her newly acquired skills.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Ticking Time Bomb" - Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Dark Secrets" - A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Destination" - A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Toxic Forces" - Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Derailed" - A train passenger behaves oddly en route to Arizona and then disappears. The next day his bloodied body is found in Texas. Dr. G attempts to piece together this bizarre tragedy.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Broken Lives" - Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Portlandia:Pull-Out King
programme.desc: A punk from the '80s wakes up from a coma. An e-mail goes neglected. Nina has surprising news for Lance. Malcolm and Kris tailgate a Prairie Home Companion live show. Carrie dates a tax lawyer.

programme.title: Portlandia:Spyke Drives
programme.desc: Peter drives Nance to the emergency room. Spyke gets a car. Ghavin has some questions for a singer (Annie Clark) whose band is touring through Portland. Fred and Carrie have a garage sale.

programme.title: Portlandia:Bahama Knights
programme.desc: Carrie and Fred go home after a concert. Fred has an idea for a music documentary. Peter is reunited with his old band, The Bahama Knights and his ex-wife lead singer (Maya Rudolph). Guest starring Maya Rudolph, Tuck & Patti, and Jeff Tweedy.

programme.title: Portlandia:Trail Blazers
programme.desc: Kickstarter videos compete at the Can'ts Film Festival (hosted by Gus Van Sant). Toni and Candace coach the Portland Trail Blazers' dance team. Guest starring Gus Van Sant, Paul Allen, The Portland Trail Blazers & dancers.

programme.title: Portlandia:Late in Life Drug Use
programme.desc: Brendan and Michelle decide that it's finally time to try drugs. Carrie's brother (Josh Homme) comes to visit with his new boyfriend. Women and Women First is visited by the cops. Guest starring Kyle MacLachlan, Dan Savage, and Josh Homme.

programme.title: Portlandia:3D Printer
programme.desc: Mr. Mayor (Kyle MacLachlan) unveils Portland's official 3D Printer. Santa is concerned about the future of Christmas. A minister (Ed Begley Jr.) reminds us that church is an option.

programme.title: Portlandia:Getting Away
programme.desc: Portlandia gets away for the weekend to New Beavertown, Oregon. Toni and Candace lead a feminist moon retreat for women (including k.d. lang).

programme.title: Portlandia:The Story of Toni and Candace
programme.desc: The origin story of the feminist bookstore. A merger between two corporate book retailers pits young, sexy, shoulder-pad-wearing Toni and Candace against one another in fierce competition to be head of the Chick Lit Department.

programme.title: Portlandia:The Fiancee
programme.desc: A visit from Lance's mom and her new boyfriend puts pressure on Lance and Nina's relationship. Guest starring Justin Long.

programme.title: Portlandia:Healthcare
programme.desc: A series of health ailments creates a desperate search for medical solutions. Guest starring Ed Begley Jr. and Brigitte Nielsen.

programme.title: Portlandia:Seaworld
programme.desc: The Ecoterrorists travel to San Diego to take down their next target, Seaworld. Guest starring Jeff Goldblum and Natasha Lyonne.

programme.title: Portlandia:4th of July
programme.desc: Kath and Dave attempt the ultimate Independence Day BBQ. The Mayor searches the deep web for truly spectacular fireworks. Guest starring Kyle MacLachlan and Jane Lynch.

programme.title: Portlandia:Fashion
programme.desc: Portland's Dollar Store recruits Quinn as the face for their rebranding campaign. Spyke faces trial for making unlicensed Bart Simpson merchandise. Guest starring Ed Begley Jr., Matt Groening, and Oscar the Grouch.

programme.title: Portlandia:Doug Becomes a Feminist
programme.desc: Doug discovers that he is a male feminist. Sandra takes a rideshare for the first time. Guest starring Greta Gerwig and Graham Wagner.

programme.title: Portlandia:House for Sale
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie's landlord moves into their house. Kath and Dave look to buy a new home for their next renovation project. Guest starring Steve Buscemi and Anna Gunn.

programme.title: Portlandia:You Can Call Me Al
programme.desc: Kath and Dave scramble to rehearse for a karaoke party. Guest starring Vanessa Bayer, Jeff Goldblum, and Paul Simon.

programme.title: Portlandia:Dead Pets
programme.desc: Police begin profiling weirdos after arsonists burn down a taxidermy shop. Guest starring Paul Reubens and Olivia Wilde.

programme.title: Portlandia:Pickathon
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. The Flaming Lips headline Portland's Pickathon Music Festival. Brendan and Michelle attend the festival via drone. Two concertgoers go boy-crazy. Guest starring Alia Shawkat, Kyle MacLachlan.

programme.title: Portlandia:Going Gray
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Fred wakes up with gray hair and sets out on a journey to find out how old he is. Carrie is faced with a life decision. Guest starring Kyle MacLachlan, Natasha Lyonne, Mitchell Hurwitz and Kumail Nanjiani.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Robert Mac - Back to Lake Titicaca
programme.desc: Robert Mac returns to the Dry Bar stage with less smartness, less subtleness, and even more silliness.

programme.title: Byron Trimble - Diary of a Short City Boy
programme.desc: Byron Trimble has traveled around the world doing comedy for conferences, churches, retreats, clubs, schools, and corporate events. He has been featured on NBC, ABC, Living Oklahoma, and the Dan Patrick Show. His hilarious blend of music and comedy in his live shows and the following generated by his online videos have enabled him to share the stage with nationally known comedians like John Crist and Anita Renfroe. Raised in Detroit, MI, he now lives in Tulsa, OK with his beautiful wife, Hannah, and three young children. Yet, he says his greatest success might be being a pastors kid his whole life and never being arrested.

programme.title: Kristin Key - Crafty
programme.desc: Kristin Key grew up a minister’s daughter in a small town in West Texas. Much like Footloose, she was raised in a no-drinking, no-dancing, no instrumental music environment. She seemed like any other well-behaved girl… until she opened her mouth. It was obvious from the beginning that she had a quick wit and undeniable sense of humor.

programme.title: Lamont Ferguson - You Had All Day
programme.desc: Ferguson has appeared on the Tonight Show, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed and ABCís Family Channel. He was the Winner of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Three time semi-finalist at the Boston Comedy Festival, Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and named ëBest of Festî at the Detroit, Lucky Eagle and San Luis Obispo Comedy Festivals. He has the distinction of being one of the only comics in the country that has opened for all of the following comedians: Steve Harvey, George Lopez, Larry Miller, Garry Shandling, Richard Jeni, and George Carlin.

programme.title: Brad Upton - Will Be Funny For Money
programme.desc: Brad Upton first stepped on stage in September of 1984 and he's never looked back. This ex-grade school teacher is now in his 30th year of comedy and is nearing 6000 lifetime performances. He is a past winner of the Las Vegas Comedy Festival and appeared recently at Caesar's Palace as part of the HBO Comedy Festival. He has spent the last eight years as the opening act for the legendary Johnny Mathis and did multiple shows all over the country with the late, great Joan Rivers. He has also been seen in concert with The Smothers Brothers, Smokey Robinson, Kenny Rogers, Dolly Parton, Lewis Black, George Jones, Glen Campbell, Pam Tillis and many others. Coast to coast all over North America isn't the only place Brad performs. In 2014 Brad headlined in Singapore, Hong Kong, The MGM in Macau and did eight nights in Israel as part of the Comedy for Koby benefit. His new CD entitled, "Brad Uptonogood" is heard regularly on Sirius Satellite Radio and is available online wherever music is sold. He also just released his first DVD entitled, "Brad Upton, Live from the 509".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Andy Hendrickson - Left Field
programme.desc: Andy Hendrickson has multiple TV appearances including: The Late Show with David Letterman, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, Gotham Comedy Live, NBC/Seeso’s The Guest List and more. Internationally, Andy has performed at clubs and festivals throughout the world, including Canada, England, Holland, and Ireland. He also performed for our troops on Outback’s Feeding Freedom Tour that provided entertainment for the troops on military bases across Afghanistan.

programme.title: Ty Barnett - Yep
programme.desc: Ty Barnett, a Chicago native, got his start at Seattle’s Comedy Underground. Whoopi Goldberg called Ty “hilarious” and reviewers have said he is “thought provoking” and “edgy”. All this praise earned him many television appearances. He hosted the Food Network’s Mealin’ and Dealin’, Discovery Family’s Babies Behaving Badly and Beasts Behaving Badly, and appeared in over 15 national commercials. It all began when he was one of the two finalists on the most-watched and Emmy nominated season of Last Comic Standing. Ty went on to multiple Tonight Show appearances where Jay Leno called Ty “one of the funniest comedians working”. He also appeared in HBO’s Bad Boys of Comedy, his own Comedy Central Presents and one-hour special Issues. Ty was named “one to watch” by the Hollywood Reporter. He’s also been seen on the sitcoms Samantha Who, Til Death, Life in Pieces, NickMom Night Out and Tosh.O. His comedy album, Grown Man-Baby Steps is a favorite on Sirius XM.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Reno Collier - Monkeys and Stuff
programme.desc: Reno's journey began at the Punchline Comedy Club in Atlanta, GA where he tended bar to supplement his day job. He found himself on stage during the weekly open mic night. His unique outlook on life - mixed with a six-pack, was instantly popular.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Richard Sarvate - Missed the Window
programme.desc: Richard Sarvate quit his ten year programming career in Silicon Valley to be a stand up comedian. Oops! Now he spends his nights poking fun at tech jobs.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Cam Bertrand - Sophisticated Ignorance
programme.desc: Cam shares his outlook on relationships and life through the eyes of a 23-year-old in a way that everyone can relate to. Bringing high energy and witty style that appeals to a wide demographic.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Marty Simpson - I Am Coach
programme.desc: Former high school football coach and drama teacher, Marty Simpson jokes about how to punish teenagers, getting rid of 500 bats in his attic, and how his love language is sarcasm.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Paul Morrissey - A Real Humdinger
programme.desc: Paul was raised as a sports fanatic in the tiny town of Owego, in upstate New York. After four years of playing college basketball, somehow he graduated. Aside from playing in the NBA, his dream job was to talk about sports for a living. Paul then moved to California after landing a television sports anchor job but found out quickly that he was “too much of a smart-ass” for TV news. After he was fired, Paul took his unique sense of humor to comedy club stages all over the country. In 2005, Paul was selected to perform at the HBO Comedy Festival in Las Vegas. Morrissey has also been a finalist in several national comedy competitions including Wendy’s Comedy Challenge, Comedy Central’s Open Mic Fight and Maxim’s Real Men of Comedy.

programme.title: Mike Brody - Not Afraid of Butterflies
programme.desc: Starting comedy on a whim at an open mic in the year 2000, Mike Brody has since devoted his life to perfecting the delivery of his high-energy act. Bucking the trend of the apathetic comedian, his genuine passion for his craft draws audience members into the unique world of Mike Brody: an affable, clever guy whose life is often derailed by his own neurotic, obsessive-compulsive tendencies. Brody has worked with Jay Pharoah, Dave Attell, Patrice O'Neal, Emo Philips, Joy Behar, Doug Stanhope, Doug Benson, and legendary street performer/madman/savant Wesley Willis. He is the official event comedian for the SyFy Channel’s TV show Ghost Hunters and has also appeared on the nationally syndicated radio program The Bob & Tom Show as well as The Dan Patrick Show.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Greg Morton - I Started Out, as a Baby
programme.desc: Greg Morton had only two choices in schoolyard conflicts. Learn the ways of the force, or use his wit to diffuse situations. That wit would soon lead to winning first prize in the, ‘So You Think You’re Funny Contest’ and the beginning of his stand-up comedy career. He was no longer the shy introverted kid, drawing cartoons in the corner. He had finally found his voice. A voice he would later use to direct and voice over twenty Saturday Morning cartoons. This former mobile disc jockey, who used to play songs at weddings, now sings song parodies on nationally syndicated radio shows, like the Bob and Tom Show. Take his Obama Man, sung to the tune of Candy Man, which has racked up over 4 million hits on YouTube.

programme.desc: Lindsey and Kevin give to a charity, but Nick must step in when the charity keeps asking for more money.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans - "Puzzle Master / Super Brain"
programme.desc:
Thom Hunt goes in search of people with genuine, real-life super-powers that push the known limits of the human mind and body.
Thom meets Rubik's cube champion Gabriel Dechichi, capable of solving a cube in under 10 seconds. There are people who can solve the cube faster, but Gabriel can solve 3 jumbled Rubik's cubes, purely from memory whilst blindfolded.
Thom meets musical genius, Derek Paravacini, born blind, and with a severe form of autism. Derek is able to memorise an entire piece of music after just a single hearing.

programme.desc:
Thom Hunt is in Thailand, where he meets Ru Anting with a unique ability which he discovered when he almost drowned as a child. The water from his nose squirted out of his eyes. Ru holds the world record for the fastest time to extinguish five candles by squirting milk from the eye in seventeen seconds.

programme.title: Plastic: The Real Sea Monster
programme.desc: Millions of tons of plastic enter the ocean every year, from rivers and shores, ships and platforms. The world’s scientists have studied the phenomenon and have come to alarming conclusions. Unlike other refuse, plastic stays in the water without breaking down. It becomes trapped in vast whirlpools of garbage called gyres. How is this deadly killer affecting the world’s oceans, and humanity?

programme.title: Earth in 1000 Years

With sea levels beginning to rise, scientists are looking back at past geological ages to understand the influence of ocean currents and other factors. They are searching for insights into where our planet may be headed 1000 into the future and beyond.

programme.title: Unnatural Selection
programme.desc: Life emerged three and a half billion years ago, and since then has evolved into a dazzling variety of shapes and forms. Species that are best adapted to their environment survive. Humans are playing a huge part in this development, turning grasslands and forests into fields and cities, and polluting the air and water. What is happening to evolution? The answer is very simple: us.

programme.title: Lil Yachty vs Conceited in a Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this heavyweight Sneaker Battle From Home episode, we put "Mr. Slow It Down I Just Dissed You", Conceited, up against rapper, singer, songwriter, Lil Yachty, in a 5 round sneaker battle of epic proportions! I won't spoil anything for the viewers but a lot of back and forth took place along with tons of hilarity! Watch the episode and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Allen Iverson Reminds Us Why He's The Best Dressed NBA Player Ever | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown," we're live from ComplexCon 2019 in Long Beach with special guest and NBA style legend Allen Iverson! In addition to discussing which NBA players were the best and worst dressed of the week, we take a look at some of A.I's past fits while in the league and discuss the influence he still has on current player's fashion. Iverson also tells stories about the backlash he received for not sticking to the NBA's former uniform dress code, plus more!

programme.title: James Harden's Cozy Fit Costs as Much as a New Car | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this episode of 'Tunnel Takedown,' the hosts talk PJ Tucker's latest outfit, how players tone down their fits in smaller cities, the '90s Starter jacket trend still being in style today, and Racks Hogan explains his beef with Amiri. They even try to guess the costs of outfits from superstars like James Harden and Ben Simmons. The numbers may surprise you.

programme.title: NikeStories vs Nick Engvall in a Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we put two OG's in the sneaker space against one another. In one corner we have Drew Hammell, also known as NikeStories, and in the other corner we have founder of "Sneaker History" and veteran writer in the sneaker blog space, Nick Engvall. These two go head to head in a versatile five round battle! We get to see some classic gems, we haven't seen in a while. Check it out for yourselves and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Josh Luber of StockX vs Charlotte Hornets Bismack Biyombo in a Sneaker Battle | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: (Episode shot on 5/26/2020) On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we have a "David vs Goliath" battle! In one corner he is the co-founder of one of the largest online sneaker marketplaces in the world, StockX's very own Josh Luber is here to battle! And in the other corner, he is the biggest competitor we've had so far, literally! Standing in at 6 foot 8 inches tall, center for the Charlotte Hornets, Bismak Biyombo is here to throw down in the sneaker gauntlet!

programme.title: NBA Champion Matt Barnes Reveals His Worst Dressed Teammate | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Welcome back to the premiere episode of "Tunnel Takedown" season 2 hosted by Racks Hogan Complex's vet stylist stoner, Matt Barnes 14-year NBA tunnel vet, NBA champion and hooping stoner and Gia Seo Creative Director and sockfluencer as they break down the best and worst fits from some of your favorite NBA players walking the tunnel.

programme.title: Kelly Oubre Channels His Rockstar Energy while Chris Paul's Fit Flops | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown" discusses players like PJ Tucker experimenting with patterns and new brands, Kelly Oubre's latest rockstar fit, overalls having a comeback thanks to players like Russell Westbrook, and the problem with wearing too many graphics at once. Our host Matt Barnes even takes a look at some fits from his playing days.

programme.title: Joe La Puma Breaks Down How To Pair Sneakers with Your Fits | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Joe La Puma joins the panel this week for the season two finale to discuss how to find the perfect pair of sneakers to pair with your outfit. The hosts also crown their best dressed players of the season so far, and discuss the personal styles of NBA superstars like LeBron James and Giannis Antetokounmpo. Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also give their picks for the worst tunnel outfits of the year thus far.

programme.title: Marcus Jordan Says New Air Jordan Project Is On The Way | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Son of NBA legend Michael Jordan, Marcus, stops by this week on 'Tunnel Takedown.' He teases an upcoming Air Jordan project with his store Trophy Room coming in 2020, and gives his thoughts on the latest fits from stars like Kemba Walker and PJ Tucker. Host Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also discuss Carmelo Anthony's style to celebrate his recent return to the NBA and roast some more of the league's most flagrant fits.

programme.title: Racks Loses It Over Russell Westbrook and JaVale McGee Needs a Shirt | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week, Racks Hogan, Mouse Jones and Kalysse Anthony break down their favorite looks of the week and get into a heated discussion over Russell Westbrook. Plus, renowned stylist Derek Roche previews the upcoming style trend while on the set of French Montana's new video. Then, Kalysse walks us through the do's and don'ts of Dopp kits and the hosts go in on JaVale McGee's bold fit.

programme.title: TMarkGotKickss Vs WhoisHeck In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we are putting two acquaintances against one another. In one corner we have the Chief Operating Officer of PrivateLabelNYC, Hector Aponte, taking on the outfit grid king, Terrel Marcus aka TMarkGotKickss! Both battlers displayed a wide variety of hyped and exclusive sneakers you won't see often! Check out the episode and let us know who won this battle?!

programme.title: Kyle Kuzma Shows Up in Supreme and PJ Tucker Keeps It Comfy | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week, hosts Racks Hogan, Kalysse Anthony and Mouse Jones get into it over PJ Tucker's satin Dolce & Gabbana outfit, and break down Kevin Durant and Kyle Kuzma's pre-game fits. Then, celebrity stylist Derek Roche shows us how to put looks together for a tall, athletic basketball player. Plus, the hosts go head-to-head in a game of Guess Who, and celebrate the legacies of Dwyane Wade and Dirk Nowitzki.

programme.title: Detroit Pistons Langston Galloway vs Nike SB Collector in a Sneaker Battle From Home!
programme.desc: On this episode we have NBA player and sneaker collector, Langston Galloway, from the Detroit Pistons going up against Complex's "Best Kept Secret" Kevin Luyster in an epic Sneaker Battle From Home! Both came equipped with a variety of sneakers in an all out 5 round battle! You won't get any spoilers here, watch the episode and decide for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Qias Omar vs HesKicks In A Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we pit two "Shoetubers" against one another. They both started their respective channels back in 2012, Heskicks vs Qias Omar, is a battle of old school collecting versus new school hype! The two put on a display of versatility for the public in an incredible 5 round battle! Make sure you watch and debate for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Lavar Ball vs Jacques Slade In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we managed to put on the most unexpected pairing to date! In one corner, he is an OG to the Sneaker Youtube space, some would consider him the Godfather of sneaker unboxing videos, @Jacques Slade aka Kustoo is here to battle! His opponent is the undefeated one, this man NEVER LOST a single competition of any sort in his life, Lavar Ball is here to battle! Watch the battle and let us know who won this matchup!

programme.title: Watch King Combs Choose Between Drake & Pusha T for Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: Complex Brackets is a new game show from Complex News where your favorite celebs choose the best rapper in any one of these four categories: Best East Coast Rapper, Best West Coast Rapper, Best Rapper of the Decade, and Best Rapper of All Time. In this episode, King Combs hits a wall when he has to choose between Drake and Pusha T for the crown of Best Rapper of the Decade. Be sure to check out Complex Brackets every Monday at 2:00pm EST right here on Complex News.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Crowns The Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: The Dirty South dominates throughout this episode when Moneybagg Yo sticks to his roots as he goes through our Best Rapper of the Decade bracket. The Memphis rapper delivered upset after upset while being faced with tough choices between hip hop giants and rappers who spoke to his life growing up. Make sure you share your choices in the comments below. Would you have picked the same?

programme.title: James Harden Rocks Louis Vuitton and Chris Paul Reps Black-Owned Brands | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On the latest "Tunnel Takedown," hosts Kalysse Anthony, Mouse Jones and Racks Hogan can't agree on Russell Westbrook's latest look and break down why James Harden's Louis Vuitton outfit missed the mark. Then, we shout out Chris Paul for his support of black designers, and Racks explains how to tell the difference between an original vintage t-shirt and a reproduction.

programme.title: The Perfect New York Slice with Frank Pinello and Michael Imperioli | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: In New York City, pizza isn't just food, it's a way of life. But which iconic NY-style dish reigns supreme: the Sicilian square or the classic round pie? In the series premiere of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Best Pizza's Frank Pinello to find out which slice is the true king of New York. And who better to judge the event than legendary actor and pizza obsessive Michael Imperioli?

programme.title: Binging with Babish Judges Movie-Inspired Pizzas: Nicole Russell vs Mike Greenfield | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Which movie-inspired pizza reigns supreme: the broccoli-topped pie from Inside Out, or "pizza in a cup" from The Jerk? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, Binging with Babish has challenged her and Pro Home Cooks' Mike Greenfield to take his silver-screen recreations to the next level. Will Nicole's Cup O' Pizza earn her a much-needed victory following a tough loss to Frank Pinello in Episode 1?

programme.title: The Ultimate Viral Pizza Showdown with Mike Hauke, Mark Iacono, and Scott Wiener | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Ramen, tacos, cheeseburgers, fried chicken-Mike Hauke of Tony Boloney's can turn just about anything into a pizza. But has the undisputed king of Instagramable pies finally met his match? In a brand new episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell attempts to wrestle the crown from Dr. Franken-slice in a viral pizza showdown for the ages. Will Nicole's popcorn-crusted bar pie be enough to topple Mike's bone-in "Flaming Cowboy"? Only pizza pros Mark Iacono and Scott Wiener can decide.

programme.title: Sean Evans and Farideh Sadeghin Taste Test Chicago Deep Dish Made by Two New Yorkers | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Can two thin-crust loving New Yorkers make deep dish pizza fit for a Chicago native? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza maker she must face off against Josephine Giordano of Lenny's Pizza to see if she can conquer the Windy City's most controversial culinary export. Will Nicole's chicken parm-packed deep dish be enough to the win the favor of Muchies' Farideh Sadeghin and Chicago native Sean Evans?

programme.title: The Perfect Detroit-Style Pizza with Cliff Skighwalker, Adam Richman, and Reina Scully | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Detroit is home to some of America's most delicious pizza. But who can create the ultimate Motor City-inspired slice? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, she must face off against chef Cliff Skighwalker in a good ol' fashioned pan-pizza throwdown.

programme.title: Mythical Chef Josh and Nicole Russell Make Taco Bell and Beef Patty Inspired Pizzas | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Pizza is the ultimate blank canvas for culinary innovation. In this episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Mythical Chef Josh to see who can create the ultimate "mashup pie." At Mythical Kitchen, Josh has perfected the art of fast-food fusion, but will his Doritos Locos Taco Pizza be enough to take down Nicole's Jamaican beef patty-inspired pie? The choice is up to this week's judges: Complex's Speedy Morman and chef Jae Lee of Nowon in NYC.

programme.title: Neapolitan-Style Pizza at Home with Vito Iacopelli, Nicole Russell, and Daym Drops | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: It's the season finale of Pizza Wars, and host Nicole Russell must now battle the final boss: master pizzaiolo Vito Iacopelli. Will Nicole's tandoori-inspired pizza be enough to impress food review legend Daym Drops, or will Vito's "connolo-style" slice steal the golden pizza trophy away from her for good? Only one oven can handle a pizza cage match of this magnitude: The Ooni Koda 16. Tune in to a very special episode of Pizza Wars to see who comes out on top.

programme.title: Maluma Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Global Colombian superstar Maluma goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Flight Club in Miami and talks about his love for the Nike Mags, meeting Virgil Abloh, and seeing his grandfather's appreciation for New Balance.

programme.title: Sean Evans Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Hot Ones host Sean Evans goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his favorite sneakers growing up, getting his own Reebok collaboration, and some of his trademark sneakers.

programme.title: Roman Reigns Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: WWE superstar Roman Reigns goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Solefly in Miami and talks wearing Jordans in the ring, admiring Ken Griffey Jr. and having the best sneaker game in wrestling.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Moneybagg Yo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his mom working for Nike in Memphis, winning dice games to get money for sneakers, and his crazy sneaker collection.

programme.title: Soulja Boy Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Soulja Boy goes Sneaker Shopping at SoleStage in Los Angeles and talks about being the rapper who started the Bape trend, being the first rapper to wear Nike Mags, buying Kanye West's Louis Vuitton sneakers in Cancun, and how lucrative his Yums sneaker deal was.

programme.title: Gay USA
programme.desc: In June 1977, Director Arthur J. Bressan, Jr. mobilized camera crews across the country to document National Gay Freedom Day marches. Gay USA conveys the passion, anger, and defiant optimism of a community under attack, and illustrates the triumphant power of love and pride. Beautifully restored in 2K by the UCLA Film & Television Archive in collaboration with Frameline and Outfest.

programme.title: Happy Birthday Marsha
programme.desc: Happy Birthday, Marsha! is a film about iconic transgender artist and activist, Marsha "Pay it No Mind" Johnson, and her life in the hours before she ignited the 1969 Stonewall Riots in New York City.

programme.title: Voguing The Message
programme.desc: A pre-Madonna primer that raises questions about race, sex and subcultural style, Voguing: The Message traces the roots of this gay Black and Latino dance form, which appropriates and plays with poses and images from mainstream fashion.

programme.title: Dykes, Camera, Action!
programme.desc: Lesbians didn't always get to see themselves on screen, but over time they built visibility and transformed the social imagination about queerness. Filmmakers Barbara Hammer, Su Friedrich, Rose Troche, Cheryl Dunye, Desiree Akhavan, film critic B. Ruby Rich, and others share moving and often hilarious stories from their lives and discuss how they've expressed queer identity through film.

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Year
programme.desc: As a dark wave of anti-transgender "bathroom bills" began sweeping across the nation, The Human Rights Campaign called 2016 the most dangerous year ever for transgender Americans. Filmmaker Vlada Knowlton captured the ensuing civil rights battle from the perspective of a group of embattled parents - including herself and her husband, parents of a young trans girl -- fighting to protect their children from discriminatory laws in their home state. While Knowlton passionately follows the story of anti-transgender legislation, the heart of the film lies in the stories of the families who accept and support their kids for exactly who they are.

programme.title: TransMilitary
programme.desc: The 2018 SXSW Audience Award-winning feature film debut by Gabriel Silverman, Fiona Dawson, & Jamie Coughlin, TransMilitary follows the Emmy-nominated short film Transgender, at War and in Love. Around 15,500 transgender people serve in the U.S. military (notably the largest transgender employer in the U.S.), where they must conceal their gender identity because military policies ban their service. TransMilitary chronicles the lives of four individuals (Senior Airman Logan Ireland, Corporal Laila Villanueva, Captain Jennifer Peace & First Lieutenant El Cook) defending their country's freedom while fighting for their own. They put their careers and their families' livelihoods on the line by coming out as transgender to top brass officials in the Pentagon in hopes of attaining the equal right to serve. The ban was lifted in 2016, but with President Trump now trying to reinstate it, their futures hang in the balance once again.

programme.title: Happy Birthday Marsha
programme.desc: Happy Birthday, Marsha! is a film about iconic transgender artist and activist, Marsha "Pay it No Mind" Johnson, and her life in the hours before she ignited the 1969 Stonewall Riots in New York City.

programme.title: Wild Combination: A Portrait Of Arthur Russell
programme.desc: Director Matt Wolf's critically acclaimed documentary examines the life and work of Arthur Russell, an influential singer, songwriter, cello player and disco auteur who died tragically in 1992. The film blends archival footage with illuminating interview segments featuring some of Russell's colleagues and most notable collaborators, including poet Allen Ginsberg, composer Philip Glass and indie pop sensation Jens Lekman.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Farm Fear Factor" - Contestants crawl through a pigsty and find themselves being dragged behind a tractor. Host Joe Rogan.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Heist Fear Factor" - Contestants are challenged to an extremely fast helicopter stunt, to crawl through a vent system filled with rats, spiders and fire, and to retrieve a prize from a sunken armoured car.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Psycho Fear Factor Episode 1" - Six couples compete in a variety of stunts while living together in the Bates Motel.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Psycho Fear Factor Episode 2" - Contestants must live together and compete in and around the "Psycho" house and the Bates Motel.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Psycho Fear Factor Episode 3" - Couples in straitjackets must eat live camel-spiders, and a home invasion in Dallas.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Family Fear Factor - Universal Orlando" - A parent must jump out of a helicopter 200 feet in the air, while the offspring goes down a 100-foot-long zipline, and a test of the contestants' acrobatic skills.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Blind Date Fear Factor" - Contestants pair up with complete strangers to manoeuvre a speeding boat beneath a helicopter and escape a small cage submerged in freezing water.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Old Vs Young Fear Factor" - Two 20-something teams take on two couples more than twice their age in a tug-of-war 100 feet in the air and a competition to drive a car onto a flatbed truck as it barrels down the highway.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Disaster Fear Factor" - With challenges such as facing hurricane-force rain and wind at 100 feet in the air, eating cockroaches, and battling a flash flood.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Crane Cannon Launch/Trash Scavenger Hunt/Heli Body Drag" - This episode featured four pairs as teams. First, it's the human cannonball. As a truck drives along a pier with a crane hanging off the side, one team member hangs from a crane and then into the water they light the fuse to giant cannon. Their partner is shot out of the cannon and into the water, swim to a boat and clip a flag to a flagpole. The team to finish fastest chooses team to be eliminated. Next, it's a trash can buffet scavenger hunt. Teams dig through dumpsters and barrels to find items. The team to match four items fastest would win a four-day trip to Las Vegas and $20,000. No one would be eliminated. The final stunt is a real drag. Team members hanging on to handlebars attached to a helicopter and are dragged across pavement on their stomachs. They have to let go as close to the finish line as possible. The team to get the least combined distance from the finish line would win $50K. The home invasion stunt goes to Dubuque, Iowa.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout is back with this exciting last season! They have created two new games, the 'Double Cross' and the 'Terror-Go-Round'. The first one consists of entering into three green platforms and exiting from a single red one as four sweeper arms come the other way. And on the second one, contestants need to keep running while the sweeper's arms move and the Terror Twins throw things at them.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Comedy duo The Rubber Bandits provide anarchic commentary and their own twisted, surreal take on the action as the increasingly bedraggled contestants make their way through the show.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: The first episode of the game show in which 50 members of the public compete - with almost no chance of winning at all. Tonight's challenges include Tiny Bike, Dizzy Hurdle and Groin Croissant.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond dons his tuxedo for a special program honoring the heroes of Total Wipeout's fifth series. The presenter starts with the 'Best new obstacle award' and will be showing the top five, and the winner for each category. Don't miss out on this special episode because surely, it will make you have good laughs!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the first 'Celebrity Special' of the season. Today, Richard Hammond presents an extraordinary game show in which ten celebrities tackle one of television's most extreme obstacle courses to win 10,000 pounds for charity. Celebrities are Dalton Grant, Ricky Groves, Gail Emms, Charlie Stayt, Roxanne Pallett, Simon Day, Brian Belo, Camilla Dallerup, Nicola McLean and Julie Peasgood.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Time again for the world of celebrity to take on the world's most outrageous obstacle course in the name of charity, and in the name of slapstick entertainment! Richard Hammond and Amanda Byram watch the likes of Marcus Patric, Peter Duncan, Susie Amy, Chris Rankin, Donna Fraser, Clare Nasir, Neil Ruddock, Melissa Suffield, Lady Sovereign, and Dom try to make it to the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout (S3,E1)
programme.desc: In the first episode of season 3, Richard Hammond introduces a brand new challenge called Crash Mountain. This involves the twelve remaining contestants from round one standing on podiums over water while three robotic arms swing around in a circular motion to knock them off.

programme.title: Total Wipeout (S3,E2)
programme.desc: Twenty foolhardy Brits attempt to conquer the purpose-built obstacle course in Argentina. Contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.desc: Chef Luis Tigretón Leon cooks up three succulent dishes that sure to please any garlic lover.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Lauren Gulyas tackles the challenge of using vanilla & vinegar in the same dish.

programme.title: Party Foods
programme.desc: Who doesn't like a plate of good nachos or Buffalo wings? We discover when you can use supermarket products versus when only good, fresh ingredients will do. A simple, sweet-tart sangria finishes our party menu.

programme.title: Barbecued Salmon
programme.desc: We were intrigued with the notion of barbecuing a whole side of salmon. Our goal was to have this large piece of fish spend enough time over the coals to pick up some real wood flavor. A bright cucumber salad adds cool, tart, and creamy flavors to complement the smoke-flavored salmon.

programme.title: Chicken in a Skillet
programme.desc: Although chicken dinners are quick to prepare, they can go terribly wrong. Part of the problem is the chicken itself-the breast meat has very little fat and becomes dry and chalky if overcooked. The other major source of trouble is improper cooking methods.

programme.title: Freedom from Red Sauce
programme.desc: Tomatoes and pasta are a classic (and delicious) pairing, but sometimes you want a change. Vegetable sauces, like the two featured in this episode-one with mushrooms and one with broccoli rabe-are appealing options.

programme.title: Grilled Chicken and Salmon
programme.desc: In this episode we prepare grilled chicken with a dipping sauce and grilled salmon with a sweet, sticky glaze.

programme.title: Holiday Cookies
programme.desc: The holidays are stressful enough. Dough that sticks to the rolling pin, cookies that melt together in the oven, and glazes that refuse to set up just won't do. We create a foolproof rolled butter cookie dough that tasted great and can be turned into an array of different cookies.

programme.title: Old-Fashioned Birthday Cake
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. No tiramisù takeoffs or cupcake shortcuts need apply. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frosting-the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: Dinner on a Dime
programme.desc: We investigate inexpensive steaks and also take a look at a classic accompaniment to steak: mashed potatoes.

programme.title: Lighter Family Favorites
programme.desc: Whether we admit it or not, there are some dishes that, while tasty, are just too high in fat and calories to be enjoyed on a regular basis. Even a modest portion of macaroni and cheese or chicken Parmesan is prohibitive. But that doesn't need to be the case.

programme.title: Two Ways with Pork
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, perhaps due to the fact that this cut is often more familiar at a restaurant table than the home kitchen. But that doesn't mean you need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: Texas Barbecue Brisket
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison a tender and delicious Texas Barbecue Brisket. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Bridget Lancaster his top pick of coolers.

programme.title: The Perfect Cake
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison and host Julia Collin Davison reveal the steps to making a showstopping Blueberry Jam Cake. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews toasters with host Bridget Lancaster.

programme.title: Smoky Barbecue Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to tackle Texas-sized, Thick Cut Smoked Pork Chops. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his pick for dry measuring cups. Finally, Julia Collin Davison reveals the secret to achieving the perfect Backyard Barbecue Beans.

programme.title: Southern Discoveries
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof teaches host Julia Collin Davison how to make the perfect South Carolina Smoked Fresh Ham. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Julia to a tasting of Spiral Sliced Bone-in Hams. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his pick for potato mashers. And finally, test cook Christie Morrison shares a fool-proof Smashed Potato Salad recipe with host, Bridget Lancaster.

programme.title: Summer Steak and Salad
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Bridget Lancaster the ultimate Grilled Thick-Cut Porterhouse Steaks. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick for paring knives. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of crumbled blue cheese. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Julia the best Caesar Green Beans.

programme.title: Ultimate Comfort Foods
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster revive a traditional recipe for Wellesley Fudge Cake. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for immersion blenders. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof makes Bridget a Southern specialty, Chicken and Pastry.

programme.title: A Spanish Affair
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison reveals the secrets to making the best Paella on the Grill with host Bridget Lancaster. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews Paella Pans in the Equipment Corner. Finally, test cook Dan Souza shows Julia how to make the ultimate Patatas Bravas at home.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table - Mexamericana
programme.desc: Pati’s family is the perfect example of cultures colliding – Mexican and American. The happy result is the creation of unique and tasty recipes. Pati dives deep into the blending of these cultures and comes up with some classic American recipes that have a delicious Mexican twist. She also takes us to a local restaurant where she learns the owner’s own unique Mex-American story.

programme.title: From Scratch - Hamburgers
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe visits a butcher to find the perfect meats to make hot dogs and BURGERS.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Monticello Wine Experiment
Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Sweet Nectar
programme.desc: In the remote reaches of Mexico, we learn how the world’s first organic fair trade honey is harvested. Chef Richard Sandoval, famed for his modern Mexican cuisine, wields a coa axe to show us how to tap the rare blue agave for its sweet syrup. With local ingredients in hand, it’s back to the kitchen where three generations of Sandoval’s prepare a Mexican feast with these sweet nectars.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Street Food Chronicles
programme.desc: Just like the entire continent of Asia, street food is hugely popular in Korea and many of the most beloved dishes in the country come from street carts and stands. On this episode, Marja and Jean-Georges eat street food all over the peninsula, including silkworm larvae, hoddeok, sweet pancakes filled with peanuts and sugar and Dragon’s Beard, a candy made of stretched honey and nuts.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Anne Kearney, Bob Waggoner, and Frank Stitt
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Smoked Salmon Terrine, Seared Red Leg Partridge with Ravioli of Foie Gras, and Blackberry Cobbler. Restaurants include: Peristyle in New Orleans, Wild Boar Restaurant in Nashville, and Highlands Bar & Grill in Birmingham.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Comfort Food
programme.desc: Stumped for meal ideas? Let Martin inspire you with his special take on some popular favourites!

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - The Spice Garden
programme.desc: Singapore was once a major seaport during the height of the spice trade. Martin picks spices from the garden of his friend Kwan Liu who has a cooking school here. They use the spices to prepare dishes with the fresh ingredients they found at the Tiong Bahru Market. This episode's recipes include: Double-Ginger Fish, Egg-Flower Soup with Lemongrass and Mushrooms, and Fluffy Cloud in Lime Syrup.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Monticello Wine Experiment
Dine & Dish Nation - Brome Modern Eatery Coop Caribbean Fusion Otus Supply
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Nathan Hochstein, Mari Nafsou and Mary Burkhardt, who review melt-in-your-mouth burgers and other favorites at the Brome Modern Eatery signature Caribbean and Asian specialties from celebrity Chef Max Hardy at the Coop Caribbean Fusion and upscale eats of pork, fish, boar and more at Otus Supply.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Jumbo Pot Stickers
programme.desc: Bundles of chopped shrimp, shiitake mushrooms and ginger are wrapped in dough and served with a lime and green onion dipping sauce. Leftovers create the base for a spicy soup.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Disappearing Act
programme.desc: The collapse of our Bee population is a crisis that could affect a third of the plants we eat and depend on. Beekeeper Dave Hackenberg takes Chef David Guas inside the hives to find out what is happening to our pollinator populations. In a picturesque Pennsylvania orchard, the chef and beekeeper watch the bees buzz, discussing ways in which these important creatures might be saved.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Bean Chronicles
programme.desc: The variety of bean-based dishes in Korean cuisine is a testament to Korea’s ingenuity and resourcefulness. On The Bean Chronicles, Marja travels to Chodang to see artisinal tofu get made the old-fashioned way with fresh soybeans and ocean water and then enjoys a four course tofu meal with fresh tofu, each preparation completely distinct and delicious enough to convince any tofu nay-sayer.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Anoosh Shariat, Richard Chamberlain, and Doyle DeForest
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Portobello Napoleon, Peppered Beef Tenderloin, and Sacher Truffle Torte. Restaurants include: Shariat’s in Louisville, Chamberlain’s Chop House in Dallas, and Flour Power in New Orleans.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Avocado
programme.desc: More than a Dip, explore Avocado Gazpacho, Pacific Rim Salad, Crab Salad and Avocado Corn Relish.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Teahouse Delights
programme.desc: Martin visits a traditional Asian teahouse and learns about the delicacies they serve. Back in his studio kitchen, Martin puts his new-found knowledge to work and cooks these quick and easy dishes.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Welcome to Mexico
programme.desc: In the first episode, Peter kicks off his adventure at the US border in the state of Chihuahua. He gets his first real taste of Tex Mex in the form of a burrito, before cooking a mouth-watering take on an old favourite - Chilli con Carne.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Fishing, Fun and Tacos
programme.desc: Having explored the beef territory of northern Mexico, it's time to head for some seafood as Peter Kuruvita descends 2000 metres by train to explore Mexico's Pacific coast - home of prawns, giant oysters and the original fish tacos.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Big Smoke
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in his first big Mexican city Guadalajara, where he will sample a classic slow cooked goat dish known as Birria, before heading to the iconic town of Tequila and going behind the scenes at a boutique distillery.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Real Mexico
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita gets to know the real Mexico, traveling to the ghost town of Real de Catorce in search of peyote, before heading south to the romantic town of Guanajuato to learn how to make the most ubiquitous of all Mexican food, tortillas.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Megacity
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in one of the largest metropolises on earth, Mexico City, discovering a city of extremes with high end dining sitting side by side with some of the cheapest and tastiest street food in the world.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - That’s a molé!
programme.desc: Contrary to popular opinion, molé is not just a chilli chocolate sauce, although molé poblano is the most well-known and this episode sees Peter Kuruvita learn the secrets to this incredibly complicated concoction.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Melting Pot
programme.desc: Episode 7 sees Peter Kuruvita arrive in the coastal state of Veracruz where he discovers the technique of smoking jalapenos into chipotles, before visiting the original home of vanilla.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Culinary Capital
programme.desc: Oaxaca is the undisputed culinary capital of Mexico, and Peter Kuruvita spends a week here sampling all this city has to offer, from cheese to tamales and even a serving of grasshoppers.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Chili and Chocolate
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in the Mayan stronghold of the Yucatan Peninsula, major producer of one of the hottest chilies on earth - the Habanero, before heading to the state of Tabasco where chocolate has been consumed for thousands of years.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Mexico’s Last Frontier
programme.desc: In the final episode of Mexican Fiesta, we travel to the cloudy forests of Chiapas near the border with Guatemala where Peter explores a state with the highest indigenous population in Mexico and with it, some of the most interesting food yet.

programme.title: Chasing The Sun: Asia - Hong Kong
programme.desc: Whether street art and tofu or Bruce Lee and the Star Ferry, Hong Kong is a city overflowing with art and history. Stephen learns about its secrets from locals and expats.

programme.desc: Luke and Crystal move in. Kevin visits a fire test lab. Jose and Anna’s house gets roof shingles. Mark installs a stone veneer. Kevin tours farms. Jenn meets an architect who designed a town memorial.

programme.title: Paradise | Paradise Strong
programme.desc: Paradise residents discuss rebuilding. Tom inspects engineered siding. Richard looks at a backup battery. A former fire chief discusses preparation. At the Memorial, heroes and survivors are honored.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Cape Ann Shingle Style
programme.desc: Homeowners put the history back into their 1890s Shingle-style home. They’ll restore the home’s original beauty and update it for modern living.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Between and Rock and Hardwood
programme.desc: Tommy and Kevin start to lay subfloor in the dining room. Charlie explains drilling granite for the new garage and driveway. Kevin tours Cape Ann then joins Tommy to move an interior doorway.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Losing Our Truss
programme.desc: Tommy and Charlie create a cathedral ceiling. Mark breaks through the foundation to make space for mechanicals. Kevin learns about sun tunnels and Richard creates a plan for cooling.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Hard Work Ahead
programme.desc: Mark McCullough matches new stone to the old on the porch. Heath buries electrical underground. Kevin, Molly and kitchen designer Michele look for design inspiration. Tommy creates a barrel ceiling.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Shingled Out
programme.desc: Rounded-top windows are installed. Easy-install roof shingles go down. Roger takes Kevin fishing. Tommy adds a diamond shingle siding detail. Radiant heat goes in somewhere unexpected: the ceiling.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Tiling is a Family Affair
programme.desc: Tommy repairs 130-year-old pocket doors. A new type of solar goes in. Jenn works with landscaper Fred to build a boulder wall. Richard gives a lesson on the modern furnace. Father Mark and son Erik Ferrante showcase the art of mosaic tile installation.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Window on Restoration
programme.desc: Original leaded glass windows are repaired. Jenn and Fred plant a bed of perennials along the new driveway. Mini splits solve a ductwork problem. Homeowner Molly and her designer Shelby make design decisions. Tommy tackles tricky original trim.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Don't Rip It, Restore It
programme.desc: Richard learns about the invention of the Stillson wrench. Mauro repairs old plaster. Norm repairs broken balusters. Heath installs a new panel. Venetian plaster goes on the dining room ceiling.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Master Craftsmen
programme.desc: A brass handrail is created. Mauro paints a chalkboard finish. Repaired balusters get reinstalled. Richard gives a lesson in make-up air. Work begins on a custom table. Heath talks smart electricity.

programme.title: Cape Ann | Move in Day
programme.desc: Work is complete on the Cape Ann Shingle Style project. The team tours the finished home, celebrating all of the repaired historic details and the new elements that keep with its original style.

programme.title: Built-In, Dining Room Light | Ask TOH

programme.title: Ask TOH | Bulkhead, Recirc Pumps
programme.desc: The twelfth season of Ask This Old House begins with Kevin teaching the guys how to use Twitter. Tom replaces an old, rusted bulkhead door. Richard discusses several ways to get hot water without waiting. And the guys ask "What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Chili Peppers, Flange
programme.desc: Roger builds a garden bed for chile pepper plants in New Mexico. Richard repairs a leaky toilet with a worn out flange. And the guys ask "What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | No Hands Faucet, Drain
programme.desc: Richard replaces a leaking kitchen faucet with a new hands-free model. Kevin explains rechargeable batteries. Roger installs a channel drain in a driveway to divert rainwater. And the guys ask ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Front Door, Container Garden
programme.desc: Tom visits Seattle where he helps a homeowner install a new, pre-hung front door. Richard discusses an important water heater safety device. Roger shows how to use big containers for screening and shading in a backyard. And the guys ask ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Shade, Hybrid Heater
programme.desc: Kevin visits Santa Fe and explores the Santa Fe style of architecture. Then he installs a shade sail over a deck to cut down on sun exposure. Roger shows the proper way to use a wheelbarrow. And Richard installs a hybrid water heater that saves energy.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Assistant Living
programme.desc: Kendra enlists the help of an old friend when she signs on for a celebrity cooking show in NYC. Away from home, Kendra confides that she and Hank need to move forward, not backwards, or their marriage is over.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Travails With My Aunt
programme.desc: While working in NYC, Kendra meets her long-lost aunt and gets heated about her fall out with her mom. Later that night, Kendra parties with Eddie and poses for some sexy photos at a gay club.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Thirty Is The New Kendra
programme.desc: Kendra heats up the competition on a cooking show in New York while Hank pulls off some big surprises for her 30th birthday. Back home, Kendra gets trashed by Holly Madison in her scandalous tell-all book.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Payback Is A Holly
programme.desc: When Kendra's handed a public trashing in Holly Madison's tell-all book, she's shocked and outraged, and eager to confront her former housemate about her scandalous accusations.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Close Encounters of the Hank Kind
programme.desc: Kendra reaches out to her ex, Hugh Hefner, after Holly's scandalous accusations. In couples therapy, Kendra admits to texting other men and intimacy issues after Hank's sex scandal.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:The Sexorcist
programme.desc: Kendra and Hank meet a sex therapist who gives them love energy exercises that prove challenging for the competitive couple. Frustrated, Kendra threatens to walk out.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Dots Amore
programme.desc: Kendra and Hank attend an intimacy retreat as a last resort to strengthen their troubled marriage. When Hank questions Kendra's seriousness during a romantic dinner, the retreat takes a turn for the worse.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Tantric or Treat
programme.desc: Kendra and Hank invite Jessica and Kyle over for dinner to share what they've learned at their sex retreat. Kendra takes over the kitchen and shares some fun intimacy games with her friends.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Breast Intentions
programme.desc: Kendra's dad, Eric, surprises the family with his new fiancee, Amy. Kendra's happy for her dad, but wary of Amy's motives. When things get wild at a Playboy Mansion party, Eric calls Kendra and Hank for help.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:A Midsummer's Night Mare
programme.desc: After a wild night at the Playboy Mansion, Kendra wonders if her dad's fiancee, Amy, is in the relationship for the wrong reasons. Amy apologizes and Kendra reluctantly gives her another chance.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Kendra's Time Out
programme.desc: Kendra's wild night out with her friends takes a turn for the worse, when late-night clubbing with hot young guys makes Kendra break her promise to Hank, and he's had enough.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Hankless in Seattle
programme.desc: Kendra's late-night partying finally pushes Hank over the edge. Hank gives Kendra an ultimatum and tells her she must decide. Kendra surprises Hank in Seattle to talk about their future.

programme.title: Kendra On Top:Last Rites and Wrongs
programme.desc: After Kendra's Seattle trip doesn't go as planned, she heads to her father's wedding in San Diego, but when Hank is nowhere to be found, she's left wondering if her marriage has passed the point of no return.

programme.title: Selling It In The ATL:Deals in Heels
programme.desc: When power broker, A'lana, gets a multi-million dollar deal, she seeks the biggest & baddest agents in the hot Atlanta market to join her team. At a private open, the agents clash when put to the test.

programme.title: Selling It In The ATL:Turnt Up Tour
programme.desc: Sarah invites the other agents to a private Beltline tour in her plan to impress A'lana, but sparks fly when Jae and Tahlia clash again. A'lana picks her multi-million dollar investor team.

programme.title: Selling It In The ATL:Hired & Fired
programme.desc: Gwen celebrates her return to real estate by hosting a ladies brunch. Chrishena shows a luxury condo to A'lana's investor. Tahlia & Jae erupt again at a lunch to hash out their differences.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Five" - To advance in this challenge, the seven remaining chefs must purchase and prepare food for a wedding reception.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Six" - Melissa joins the men in a competition to see which team can prepare better lobster dishes. But there's a catch: the teams must kill their crustaceans first.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Seven " - The six remaining contestants must make appetizers and entrées from leftovers, then both teams must craft their own menus for the evening's dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Eight" - Chef Ramsay consolidates the five remaining contestants into one team, but first they must compete against one another to impress 100 hungry high school students.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Nine" - The three remaining chefs prepare gourmet versions of classic American dishes for outside judges: their mothers, who don't know whose plates they're sampling.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Ten (Part One)" - The final two contestants take on a final challenge that involves more than just cooking: they must design and manage their own restaurants.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Ten (Part Two) " - In the season finale, tempers flare as the two contestants prepare one last dinner service for Chef Ramsay.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 15 Chefs Compete" - Chef Gordon Ramsay returns for a fourth season of culinary torture. Fifteen chefs will compete for the chance to work at Ramsay's own restaurant in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 14 Chefs Compete" - The season's first challenge finds the contestants slicing halibut into thin six-ounce fillets. One member of each team must serve as maître d' during the dining service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 13 Chefs Compete" - After chickens wake them up in their living quarters, the contestants must pluck what once clucked, then cook them for the evening's family-style dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 12 Chefs Compete" - The two teams compete to make the most pasta for the evening's dinner service, and a kitchen accident puts one contestant in the hospital.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Spin a Yarn
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits a fifty-year-old steakhouse. Despite the restaurant's rich history, it's long overdue for a visual and culinary makeover.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Yanni's
programme.desc: In Seattle, Chef Ramsay hopes to improve a family-owned Greek restaurant that resists catering to the changing demographic of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Prohibition Grille
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps professional belly dancer-turned-restaurant owner Rishi with her eatery. With little kitchen experience, Rishi lets the head chef control kitchen operations.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mangia Mangia (Part One)
programme.desc: An Italian restaurant in Woodland Park, Colorado is beset with problems, including an incompetent head chef and low morale among the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mangia Mangia (Part Two)
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay suggests a few top-down changes to help Mangia Mangia survive.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: La Frite
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay treks to Sherman Oaks, California to rescue a French eatery from peril as the brother-sister owners feud over the restaurant.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Capri
programme.desc: While visiting the Eagle Rock area of Los Angeles, Chef Ramsay stops by Capri. This Italian restaurant is filthy, serves terrible food and is in disarray all thanks to a lazy set of twins.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Kingston Cafe
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay makes a trip to Pasadena, California to whip an eatery specializing in Caribbean cuisine into shape.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Greek at the Harbor
programme.desc: Greek at the Harbor is on the verge of closing. It's up to Chef Ramsay to save the waterfront venue by improving the menu, the dated décor and the relationship between its owners.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Luigi's
programme.desc: In Anaheim, California, Chef Ramsay performs an extreme makeover on Luigi's. The Italian eatery faces management conflicts after the owner retires and leaves the business to his sons.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 2'' - In the conclusion of the finale, one designer is named the winner of Project Runway Season 8.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Come As You Are'' - 20 designers must go in front of Heidi, Michael, Nina, and Tim to make a case for why they deserve one of the 16 coveted spots this season. Once they are chosen, the 16 designers barely have a chance to celebrate before being awoken at the crack of dawn with one of the toughest first challenges in the series' history. Tim wakes up the designers and tells them to grab their bedsheets and come as they are. Their PJ's and bedsheets are their fabric for the first challenge! Actress Christina Ricci guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''My Pet Project'' - This year's Unconventional Materials Challenge lives up to its name when the designers arrive at a pet store. When Tim informs them that they will find all the materials they need inside, they quickly realize that this is their opportunity to show the judges how they can think outside the box. Stacey Bendet (Alice + Olivia) guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Go Big or Go Home'' - The designers are broken into teams of two to create larger-than-life designs for stilt walkers! In the first-ever outdoor challenge, the runway show is held for all to see. Kim Kardashian guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''All About Nina'' - The designers quickly realize they are in for a tough challenge when it is revealed that Nina Garcia is their client! The stakes are raised as Nina tells them that she will wear the winning look to an important industry event. Editor in Chief of Marie Claire magazine, Joanna Coles, and actress Kerry Washington guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Off the Track'' - The designers are instructed to put on New Balance clothing sets and meet Heidi and Tim at a track and field center to hear about the latest challenge. There, they learn that they will be competing in teams to design pieces inspired by "Heidi Klum for New Balance" sneakers. But in order to be crowned team captain, they must win a different kind of race—on foot! Model Erin Wasson guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''The Art of the Matter'' - The designers become students for a day when they are partnered with kids from Harlem School of the Arts to create a piece of art that will serve as the inspiration for their next garment. Kenneth Cole guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Can't We Just All Get Along?'' - To the delight of the designers, the HP Create Your Own Fabric Challenge is back—with a twist! With the use of an HP Touchsmart, designers will work in two teams of five to create a cohesive collection. Armed with HP video cameras, they head out into the city to tell the story of what truly inspires them. Designer Rachel Roy and actress Rose Byrne guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''What Women Want'' - When Heidi introduces nine men on the runway, the designers are stunned. But they quickly breathe a sigh of relief when Tim reveals that the men are not their models. Instead, they will be designing for their significant others! Actress Malin Akerman guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Image is Everything'' - The designers are treated to a special performance from their new client: an up-and-coming band. Broken into two teams of four, the designers are charged with creating looks that will establish them as image-makers.

programme.title: Verdad Oculta:Episodio 11
programme.desc: Después de la caída de un infame narco-líder, el coronel Diana está lista para tomarse un descanso de la policía y trabajar para arreglar su matrimonio. Su jefe, sin embargo, tiene otros planes y le asigna al coronel Diana su mayor misión hasta la fecha: desmantelar "el Clan del Norte" dirigido por los hermanos Zurria y sus aliados oficiales corruptos y funcionarios del gobierno.

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E215
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is singer and pianist Jeon Jin hee! This artist burst into the music industry as the leader of the quartet Ravie Nuage. Then she started her career as a solo artist in 2017 with the album, "Piano and Voice," featuring a number of talented vocalists, including Nine from Dear Cloud, Kwak Jin-eon, and Lee Young-hoon. Renowned for her ability to empower vocalists by offering instrumental support when they need it the most, she provides empathy with her heartfelt music delivered through varied voices. In January this year, Jeon Jin hee released her first instrumental album, "Breathing," featuring 13 tracks she shared on her SoundCloud. Each track is associated with each month of the year, letting us enjoy all 12 months in a new creative way. In this episode, Jeon Jin hee performs "Our Love Was Summer," "daymoon," "We Lost Us," as well as "summer,night" and "rain,summer,night" from her latest album. Tune in to I'm LIVE and meet this wonderful artist!

programme.title: BLACKPINK House: S1 E6
programme.desc: It is a New Year in BLACKPINK House! The members prepare sliced rice cake soup per Korean tradition. BLACKPINK also goes to an amusement park and find themselves in the middle of a safari zoo.

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E188
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is the talented quintet ONEWE! ONEWE is an alternative rock band, composed of YongHoon, KangHyun, HaRin, DongMyeong, and CyA. The band's name is a combination of "one" and and "we shine on you," which speaks to the members' ambition to shine on everyone and become one in the name of music. With exceptional talents in songwriting and lyric-writing, the five young musicians never fail to impress listeners. Not surprisingly, the quintet is expanding their audience reach both at home and abroad, and their single "Q" entered the Billboard World Digital Song Sales Chart in April last year. Each member boasts his own distinctive musical talents, so their music is versatile and kaleidoscopic, yet harmonious. In this episode, ONEWE performs "Regulus," "Crazy," "ONEWE Medley" and more to show off their musicality. Tune in to I'm LIVE and meet these talented, ambitious five artists!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Spiker
programme.desc: The year was 1983 and volleyball was everywhere! Beaches! Family reunions! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Three Magic Words
programme.desc: Yes, Pork, the delicious substance we've been known to indulge in every now and then here at RiffTrax. And since we buy it using the titular Three Magic Words, we'll always know we've got the best pork. What are the Three Magic Words? Quality, freshness and flavor! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill as they are serenaded about the joys of quality, fresh, flavorful pork. Over...and over...and over again...

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Trucker's Woman
programme.desc: If the old dusty carousel of audio cassettes at a truck stop could be distilled into a movie, this would be that movie. From the title to the fashion to the hair to the faces, one of the most 70s things you will ever experience is Trucker’s Woman! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).
